page.title: 02Curdridge Primary School.
page.content: The school was founded as a National School in 1839. It was built of yellow brick and had a slate roof. In 1874 it became a Board School and a red brick extension was built with a bell tower and bell on the new tiled roof. In recent years a kitchen and two offices have been added as well as a temporary class room. The outside toilets have been demolished and internal ones installed. The school has 94 pupils and four teachers, as well as two non-teaching assistants, a secretary, caretaker, cook, kitchen assistant and two supervisory assistants. Many parents help in the school on a voluntary basis. Children start at the school in the term in which they become five, and move to Wildern Comprehensive School, Hedge End at eleven plus.
